data.title: Solid food and one of many excellent Hispanic food places in Indio
data.text: Very busy especially in the busy winter tourism month. Food is hearty and plentiful and well priced. Our meal was a little slow in coming but they were full at the time with people waiting

data.title: So Good!
data.text: I was told by a co-worker to try this place when we made our way through here. It was very good! Authentic, homemade Mexican food! Friendly service and big portions for what we paid! Must try!

data.title: Homemade Mexican Food!
data.text: When in Indio I visit my favorite Mexican Café on Indio Blvd., it's a small café with great homemade Mexican food, the taco, enchilada, burritos, beans and rice are fantastic and very  authentic tasting, you get plenty of chips and salsa and my servers are always very attentive, the place does get packed at the noon hour but worth the wait. It's a small place that's located in what I call the industrial part of town but worth a visit, I recommend at least one visit and from there you may become a repeat visitor customer as I have!

data.title: Food tasteless..............what happened?
data.text: Fifteen years ago and for many, many years this has been our go to place for original Mexican food. Always delicious....with great service. Went there a few weekends ago..............tasteless food!!!  We all looked at each other thinking it was maybe one dish..............they were all tasteless.  Found out that the man who owned it died.   He's son took over!!!!!!!!!!!   Well, get it back to what it was. Don't know what you did but it is wrong. Not recommended until some big changes are made.

data.title: Very Good Traditional Mexican Fare
data.text:
Went with friends today for lunch. Excellent ambiance considering what we we wanted. 

A couple staff had called in sick so we had the owner. Loved my burrito, others had an enchilada and fish tacos. It was very authentic, served efficiently and hot. We had excellent attention and all was very good. Prices were reasonable and we had a great time. 

We'll be back. Happy hour prices look excellent. Mucho Bueno.

I'm not really impressed by this restaurant I ordered a chavela and when I started drinking it I was able to smell something weird on the cup I don't know if they don't use soap or just using a dirty rag. Kitchen needs and update, I only go to this place because of my wife that she went with her parents then brothers and now I'm stuck, we don't go all the time now is all about Asaderos Los Corrales.

data.title: Great, Traditional, Home-Made Mexican Food!
data.text: Family-operated business in Indio for several generations by the Flores family. Went for breakfast with my family Sunday morning, and it was delicious! Always run into at least one person who I grew up with when we go there. Everyone in town goes here.  Chilaquiles with carne asada, rice & beans was warm, delicious, and excellent!  Their machaca a la Mexicana is great as well.  Traditional menudo is also a can't miss option there.  Tacos, enchiladas, and their burritos are delicious as well. Chips and that warm salsa were delicious as usual. Nothing fancy, just excellent, home-made Mexican food that is so much better than Chipotle or Rubio's.

data.title: Sub par....
data.text: Ate with my family ordered 2 meals and an app of queso the bill was over 40 dollars with tip for sub par food. I ordered my food with no beans halfway through i realized at one point my plate did have beans on it, brought this to the attention of the server. She confirmed that I ordered with no beans took it and walked away, nothing else said or mentioned about it. The food was bland and messy looking,only thing I enjoyed was the chips n salsa and my drink. The only Hispanic restaurant I've eaten at in the valley I didn't like.

data.title: This restaraunt has gone down hill
data.text: Very commercialised! Food is frozen, leftovers.  Menudo is from a can. Its sooo disappointing to see what has become of one of Indios longest standing restaraunts. Staff are sooo rude!! God forbid if you complain, then you really get treated badly. We had to just walk out before I blew it.

data.title: Wonderful Mexican food
data.text: The food is great, the service is good.  We sat outside and it's a little scary when the trains go by.  It was recommended by friends who live in the area, but they always get the food to go.  We'd definitely go back.

data.title: Yummie
data.text: Good food, good service. We enjoyed a simple bean and cheese burrito and a carne asado taco salad. Both were quite good. Seems to be popular with both Latinos and Gringos.

data.title: Warm Salsa . . . Yummmm!
data.text: Every Mexican restaurant serves salsa and chips as an appetizer, but Rincon Norteno is the only restaurant I know of that serves it warm, and it is scrumptious!  I could easily make a meal out of that with a bowl of chips.  I don't visit this restaurant often enough!  My meal on this visit consisted of Ranch-style Huevos Rancheros and it was the best I've had.  Family run for 50 years, the service was great and the staff friendly.  Great pricing for the excellent food.

data.title: Enchiladas Nuevo Mexico
data.text: Back again this morning. Great service, good prices. ENCHILADAS NUEVO MEXICO are still.the greatest! Plenty of nearby parking. Have dinner before ILAC theater.

data.title: Not What I Remembered
data.text: I used to visit more frequently when I was working in Indio.  A decade later we moved to Indio and visited a few times.  I couldn't keep going back . . . the chicken taquitos are flavorless.  It tastes like boiled chicken without any seasoning deep fried in a corn tortilla.  I DO love their warm salsa though.  Needs some seasoning!

data.title: Wonderful Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: We were craving authentic Mexican plates and went here and thoroughly enjoyed the gourmet experiece.  all the dishes were yummy and they gave us a lovely rice pudding after the meal. Indio California

data.title: OMG
data.text: The house guacamole is so good. Served with cheesed chips   Chunks of avacado onion tomato and jalapeños. Nice strong margaritas. And a lemony chicken enchilada with green sauce to die for!

data.title: great enchiladas
data.text: I had the enchiladas rancheras and they are great everytime. This place is located in downtown Indio where they have the annual tamale festival. Library also nearby

data.title: Overpriced Mexican Food
data.text: Have been several times with friends and family. Each time we always say not worth it but for some unknown reason go back. Last night my wife and I seriously looked at bill for $30.00 for two 'specials' and a beer. The food ok but noway worth the price. Will not go back and look for a better option. Overall premises and atmosphere a little too 'muy authentico'.

data.title: Best Mexican Food In The Desert
data.text: When I was a teenager, my friends and I would sneak out and go here. Now that I'm adult, I do the same thing. It's a family run restaurant that isn't fancy, but it makes my mouth water just thinking about it. If you like chips and salsa, this is the place for you. Their salsa is uniquely delightful and you won't find it like this anywhere else. Yum. You can not look at the menu and put your finger down on something and order it. Guaranteed goodness. You'll love it. It's a little off the beaten track, but it's worth it.

data.title: Consistently Good
data.text:
Come here for the special on margarita night.  Sorry but I forgot what nights they do it but a phone call to them will get you an answer.

This little place has been in business for many years and draws both hispanic and anglo customers.
